head.title: Treatment of Access to Information Requests for Audit Information (PIN) - July 1, 1984 - Canada.ca

meta.name: dc.title
meta.content: Treatment of Access to Information Requests for Audit Information (PIN) - July 1, 1984

meta.name: gc.description.Long
meta.content: Provides guidance on processing requests for audit information under the Access to Information Act.

main.h1: Treatment of Access to Information Requests for Audit Information (PIN) - July 1, 1984

div.div: Provides guidance on processing requests for audit information under the Access to Information Act.

li.a: Access to Information Act, Interim Directive on the Administration of the

div.a: Access to Information Act, Interim Directive on the Administration of the

a.strong: Treatment of Access to Information Requests for Audit Information (PIN) - July 1, 1984

div.a: Report a problem or mistake on this page

aside.h2: Government of Canada activities and initiatives

p.a: Access Government of Canada activities and initiatives

object.aria-label: Symbol of the Government of Canada

body.script: GLOSSARY.Terms = [{"id":10876,"definition":"All activities that serve to increase awareness about access to information, including formal training, research, discussion groups, conferences, access to information and privacy community meetings, shared learning among colleagues, on-the-job training, special projects, job shadowing, and communications activities that promote learning in the areas specified in \u003ca href=\"#appB\"\u003eAppendix B\u003c/a\u003e of this directive.","instrumentId":18310,"instrumentTitle":"Access to Information Act, Interim Directive on the Administration of the","name":"Access to information (ATI) training","nameTranslation":""},{"id":10003,"definition":"Is an Officer of Parliament appointed by Governor in Council.","instrumentId":12453,"instrumentTitle":"Access to Information, Policy on","name":"Information Commissioner","nameTranslation":"Commissaire à l\u0027information"},{"id":10878,"definition":"An exemption provision of the Act that contains the phrase \"may refuse to disclose.\" The following sections of the Act provide for exemptions that are discretionary: 14, 15(1), 16(1), 16(2), 16.3, 17, 18, 18.1, 21(1), 22, 22.1, 23 and 26.","instrumentId":18310,"instrumentTitle":"Access to Information Act, Interim Directive on the Administration of the","name":"discretionary exemption","nameTranslation":""},{"id":10879,"definition":"A level of effort that a fair and reasonable person would expect or would find acceptable.","instrumentId":18310,"instrumentTitle":"Access to Information Act, Interim Directive on the Administration of the","name":"every reasonable effort","nameTranslation":""},{"id":10001,"definition":"Is \"any department or ministry of state of the Government of Canada, or any body or office, listed in Schedule I, and any parent Crown corporation, and any wholly-owned subsidiary of a Crown corporation, within the meaning of section 83 of the \u003cem\u003eFinancial Administration Act\u003c/em\u003e\" (section 3). The term \"government institution\" does not include Ministers\u0027 Offices.","instrumentId":12453,"instrumentTitle":"Access to Information, Policy on","name":"government institution","nameTranslation":"institution fédérale"},{"id":10004,"definition":"Is a notice issued by Treasury Board Secretariat to provide guidance on the interpretation and application of the \u003cem\u003eAccess to Information Act\u003c/em\u003e and its related policy, directives, standards and guidelines.","instrumentId":12453,"instrumentTitle":"Access to Information, Policy on","name":"Implementation Report","nameTranslation":"rapport de mise en oeuvre"},{"id":9999,"definition":"Is the information to which the Act does not apply as described in sections 68, 68.1, 68.2, 69 and 69.1 of the Act.","instrumentId":12453,"instrumentTitle":"Access to Information, Policy on","name":"excluded information","nameTranslation":"renseignements exclus"},{"id":9998,"definition":"Is the President of the Treasury Board for the purpose of this policy.","instrumentId":12453,"instrumentTitle":"Access to Information, Policy on","name":"designated minister","nameTranslation":"ministre désigné"},{"id":10881,"definition":"An exemption provision of the Act that contains the phrase \"shall refuse to disclose.\" The following sections of the Act provide for exemptions that are mandatory: 13(1), 16(3), 16.1, 16.2, 16.4, 16.5, 19(1), 20(1), 20.1, 20.2, 20.4 and 24.","instrumentId":18310,"instrumentTitle":"Access to Information Act, Interim Directive on the Administration of the","name":"mandatory exemption","nameTranslation":""},{"id":10008,"definition":"Is intended to provide up-to-date statistics on the operation of the legislation. The reports allow the government to monitor trends and to respond to enquiries from Members of Parliament, the public and the media. The reports also form the statistical portion of the government institutions\u0027 annual reports to Parliament. The forms used for preparing the report are prescribed by the designated minister, as provided under paragraphs 70(1)(b) and (d) of the \u003cem\u003eAccess to Information Act\u003c/em\u003e.","instrumentId":12453,"instrumentTitle":"Access to Information, Policy on","name":"statistical report","nameTranslation":"rapport statistique"},{"id":10882,"definition":"Is an electronic or paper-based internal case management system used in \u003cabbr title=\"Access to Information and Privacy\"\u003eATIP\u003c/abbr\u003e offices to track access requests and document their processing.","instrumentId":18310,"instrumentTitle":"Access to Information Act, Interim Directive on the Administration of the","name":"tracking system","nameTranslation":""},{"id":9993,"definition":"Is a request for access to a record made under the \u003cem\u003eAccess to Information Act\u003c/em\u003e.","instrumentId":12453,"instrumentTitle":"Access to Information, Policy on","name":"access request","nameTranslation":"demande d\u0027accès"},{"id":9994,"definition":"Is a report submitted by the head of a government institution to Parliament on the administration of the Act within the institution during the financial year.","instrumentId":12453,"instrumentTitle":"Access to Information, Policy on","name":"annual report","nameTranslation":"rapport annuel"},{"id":10007,"definition":"Relates to the principle under the Act in which the protection of information from disclosure must be limited to the portions of information or material that the head of the government institution is authorized or obligated to refuse to disclose under the Act. The principle applies to records that are the subject of an access request.","instrumentId":12453,"instrumentTitle":"Access to Information, Policy on","name":"severability","nameTranslation":"prélèvements"},{"id":9996,"definition":"Is an individual who makes a complaint to the Information Commissioner on any of the grounds outlined in subsection 30(1) of the \u003cem\u003eAccess to Information Act\u003c/em\u003e.","instrumentId":12453,"instrumentTitle":"Access to Information, Policy on","name":"complainant","nameTranslation":"plaignant"},{"id":10005,"definition":"Is a series of annual Treasury Board Secretariat publications in which government institutions are required to describe their organizations, program responsibilities and information holdings, including classes of records. The information is to contain sufficient clarity and detail to facilitate the exercise of the right of access under the \u003cem\u003eAccess to Information Act\u003c/em\u003e. The \u003cem\u003eInfo Source\u003c/em\u003e publications also provide contact information for government institutions as well as summaries of court cases and statistics on access requests.","instrumentId":12453,"instrumentTitle":"Access to Information, Policy on","name":"Info Source","nameTranslation":"Info Source"},{"id":10880,"definition":"A test to determine the reasonable expectation of probable harm that must be met for certain exemption provisions of the Act to apply. The following sections of the Act provide for exemptions that are based on an injury test: 14, 15(1), 16(1)(c), 16(1)(d), 16(2), 17, 18(b), 18(c), 18(d), 20(1)(c), 20(1)(d) and 22.","instrumentId":18310,"instrumentTitle":"Access to Information Act, Interim Directive on the Administration of the","name":"injury test","nameTranslation":""},{"id":10877,"definition":"A test that objectively identifies the categories of information or documents to which certain exemption provisions of the Act can be applied. The following sections of the Act provide for exemptions that are based on a class test: 13(1), 16(1)(a), 16(1)(b), 16(3), 16.1, 16.2, 16.3, 16.4, 16.5, 18(a), 18.1, 19(1), 20(1)(a), 20(1)(b), 20(1)(b.1), 20.1, 20.2, 20.4, 21(1), 22.1, 23, 24 and 26.","instrumentId":18310,"instrumentTitle":"Access to Information Act, Interim Directive on the Administration of the","name":"class test","nameTranslation":""},{"id":9995,"definition":"Is a Canadian citizen, a permanent resident or any individual or corporation present in Canada who requests access to a record under the Act.","instrumentId":12453,"instrumentTitle":"Access to Information, Policy on","name":"applicant","nameTranslation":"auteur d\u0027une demande"},{"id":10000,"definition":"Is a mandatory or discretionary provision under the Act that authorizes the head of the government institution to refuse to disclose records in response to an access request.","instrumentId":12453,"instrumentTitle":"Access to Information, Policy on","name":"exemption","nameTranslation":"exception"},{"id":9997,"definition":"Is an officer or employee of a government institution who has been delegated to exercise or perform the powers, duties and functions of the head of the institution under the Act.","instrumentId":12453,"instrumentTitle":"Access to Information, Policy on","name":"delegate","nameTranslation":"délégué"},{"id":10006,"definition":"Is \"any documentary material regardless of medium or form\" (section 3).","instrumentId":12453,"instrumentTitle":"Access to Information, Policy on","name":"record","nameTranslation":"document"},{"id":10002,"definition":"Is the Minister, in the case of a department or ministry of state. In any other case, it is the person designated by the \u003cem\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/regulations/SI-83-113/\"\u003eAccess to Information Act Heads of Government Institutions Designation Order\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e. If no such person is designated, the chief executive officer of the institution, whatever their title, is the head.","instrumentId":12453,"instrumentTitle":"Access to Information, Policy on","name":"Head","nameTranslation":"Responsable"}]
